plugins.name: Peppercorn - The Perfect Type Scale
plugins.description:
If you like my work, buy me a croissant or a coffee :) https://paypal.me/abroudin thank you!


Description

Create flexible, harmonious and responsive typography scales with ease, complete with documentation, text styles bound to variables and code ready to share with your developers.


Key Features:

Primary and secondary font families: Create even more flexible type scale with 2 font families.

Documentation: Automatically generate your typography scale within a Figma frame with associated Text Styles & Variables

Naming: Name your text styles directly from the plugin, supports nesting, i.e: Headings/Title XL

Figma text Styles: Create Figma Text Styles to apply your new typography across projects effortlessly, ensuring design consistency.

Precision positioning: Select the position of predefined elements within your scale without the need to recalculate everything, saving you valuable time.

Custom elements: Add new elements to your typography scale.

Save your scale: Never lose your settings with the ability to save and revisit your typography scales whenever you wish. It will automatically be loaded.

Variables: Generate Figma variables

Responsive scales: Create multiple scales, such as mobile, tablet, laptop, desktop and large desktop, ensuring your typography is always on point.

Code generation:

  1. W3C DTCG Json
  2. Chakra UI theme
  3. CSS


Note: some Google fonts styles, like Noto Sans condensed, are not supporded yet.

plugins.name: Neubrutalist
plugins.description:
The Neubrutalist plugin simplifies the process of adding the Neubrutalism UI style to your designs. With this tool, you can effortlessly select one or multiple shapes, texts, or objects and apply a solid shadow effect, commonly seen in Neubrutalist designs. Key features include:


1. Adding shadows to single or multiple selections.

2. Customizing the color of both the selection and its shadow.

3. Adjusting the percentage offset for the shadow effect.


How to use:


1. Open the plugin.

2. Select the shapes, texts or objects you want to neubratlise.

3. Select the fill and shadow colors.

4. Select offset percentage. Default is set to 5%.

5. Execute!
plugins.tagline: Neubrutalise Anything. Simply Select Shapes, Text, or Objects and Add Shadows with Ease.

plugins.name: Auto Constraints
plugins.description:
Apply constraints layout automatically based on and object's placement within parent frame. Similar to how Adobe XD handles constraints in "Responsive Resize: Auto" mode.


For Example, a node in the top right corner of a frame will automatically receive Top, Right constraints.


Commands

Auto Constrain Selection: apply Auto Constraints to the selected object

Frame and Auto Constrain Selection: Frame the selected objects and auto constrain to the new frame

Ungroup and Auto Constrain Selection: Ungroup the selected objects and auto constrain children to the new parent frame

Watch Mode (beta): PluginUI to Auto Constrain Selection whenever object selection changes

  • This applies Auto Constraints to every element as it is selected and as it is deselected.
  • Ignore Selection: Watch Mode will not apply Auto Constraints to this node. Similar to XD's "Responsive Resize: Manual"



Set Keyboard Shortcuts on macOS

Auto Constraint commands mimic native Figma commands for Frame (‚éá‚åòG) and Ungroup (‚áß‚åòG). Setting a keybinding will allow you to replace the native commands with this plugin's version. However, you cannot override native Figma keybindings, only make new ones. My preference is to assign the same patterns to the F key instead of G.


  1. Navigate to: System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts > App Shortcuts > click "+"
  2. Select Application: "Figma.app" and set shortcut for plugin commands by pasting in the "Menu Title" in this format: Plugins->Plugin Name->Plugin Command


  • Auto Constrain Selection: Plugins->Auto Constraints->Selection - ‚åÉF
  • Frame and Auto Constrain Selection: Plugins->Auto Constraints->Frame Selection - ‚éá‚åòF
  • UnGroup and Auto Constrain Selection: Plugins->Auto Constraints->Ungroup Selection - ‚áß‚åòF


Read more on Apple support


---


Report Issues on Github
plugins.tagline: Automatically apply Constraints to an object based on its positsion (Xd's Reponsive Resize)

plugins.name: Selective Surgery
plugins.description:
Super smart batch selection by name, type, component, text content, or visibility.


Selective Surgery is a plugin for Figma that makes bulk editing a breeze. It offers a convenient palette of methods to quickly get your hands on the layers you need. Whenever you find yourself cmd + click'ing, use Selective Surgery instead!


1) Launch the plugin


Use the Plugins > Selective Surgery menu item


or better yet...


Use the quick actions bar (‚åò Command + /). Find Selective Surgery in the list!


2) Choose your operation üî™


‚û§ By Name - select layers by name


üí° Selective Surgery will aggregate all unique names in the current selection scope and provide helpful fuzzy matching.


Conditions:


  • is
  • is not
  • include
  • does not include
  • matches regex



‚û§ By Component - select layers by a specific component instance


üí° The plugin will pull up all unique components used in the current selection scope


Conditions:


  • is
  • is not


‚û§ By Type - select layers by their native Figma type


Conditions:


  • is
  • is not


Figma Types:


  • Text
  • Rectangle
  • Line
  • Ellipse
  • Image
  • Group
  • Frame
  • Component
  • Component Instance
  • Vector
  • Polygon
  • Union
  • Subtract
  • Intersect
  • Exclude
  • Star
  • Slice


‚û§ By Text Content - select objects by text contents


Conditions:


  • is
  • is not
  • include
  • does not include
  • matches regex


‚û§ By Visibility - select layers by whether they are hidden or shown


Conditions:


  • is
  • is not



3) Do something with your selection!


Examples:


  • Bulk update text styles across deeply nested layers
  • Concurrently paste the same things into multiple frames
  • Blast all the pesky hidden layers in your DS that slow everything down
  • Skillfully rename all those pesky Frame 134081 copies
  • ...or any normal design task you might do in Figma


-----

Made @ Free Association
plugins.tagline: Super smart batch selection.

plugins.name: Superposition
plugins.description:
Extract all design tokens from websites and use them directly in Figma. 

The plugin works with the free Superposition desktop application available at https://superposition.design

The Superposition desktop app intelligently parses your web page for colors, font styles, images and more, then makes them available for export as CSS, SCSS, JavaScript, Android XML and lets you use it directly in Design tools like Figma.

To use with Figma, open Superposition and go to the URL you want to get design tokens from, then open the plugin in Figma. The plugin will be kept up-to-date with the app as long as the app is open.

plugins.name: HCT color picker
plugins.description:
A color picker that keeps color contrast consistent.


With the HCT color picker, you can easily adjust the colors of different elements within your Figma document on the fly.


You can even create new styles to add to your document's palette, which will give you more control and efficiency in your workflow.


It uses Google's HCT logic to ensure that the color contrast remains accessible while preserving your color properties.


How does HCT Color Picker can help me ensure accessibility standards are met?


The color picker uses the HCT color system, which simplifies the process of meeting accessibility standards. Instead of calculating a contrast ratio, HCT measures the difference in tone or lightness between colors.


By selecting colors that have a significant enough difference in tone values, contrast is guaranteed without complex calculations.


This principle works consistently for any pair of colors; Smaller elements require a tone difference of 50 with their background and larger elements require a tone difference of 40 to meet WCAG contrast requirements. HCT keeps the tone consistent throughout hues, making it easier to pair colors. (source)


This feature is especially helpful when creating color systems based on a single brand color or ensuring that your visuals are accessible.


With the HCT Color Picker, you can select elements in the document and change their colors in real time, making the process quicker and more efficient. Try it out and see how it can improve your workflow today!


Features:

  • Select elements in the document and change their colors in real time.
  • Add new styles to the document's styles palette.
  • Change the color of the selected elements.
plugins.tagline: A color picker that uses Google's HTC color space. Fine tune, edit, save colors

plugins.name: Page Organizer
plugins.description:
Easily sort, add, and remove pages individually or as groups while preserving archived main components.


How it works

  1. Run Page Organizer
  2. Sort, add, and remove pages and groups
  3. Update Pages


Description

Page Organizer automatically stores main components in an archive page to preserve any instances throughout your file. It also automatically regroups pages when the plugin is run so they don't have to be remade. 


To change groupings, simply change the position of the group divider created by Page Organizer. It will group any pages that appear under it until the next group divider is found. This can also be done in the plugin itself using the sorting behavior.


Potential future features

Depending on downloads and usage, these features may come in the future:


  1. Custom group style
  2. Merge pages


Made by Dimitri Otero (@DimitriOtero)

plugins.name: OROR Forge (BETA) - Figma to React, HTML/CSS
plugins.description:
Figma to React, HTML/CSS


Convert your Figma designs to React, HTML/CSS.

Focus on coding business logic regardless of design.


  1. Create the models in the Figma plugin.
  2. Create component props based on the models.
  3. Link component props to the Figma node.
  4. Register a tag for interaction components.
  5. Bind actions using the tag.
  6. Replace a Figma node with an external component.

plugins.name: Reverse Layers
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin Reverse Layers allows Figma users to reverse the order the selected layers.


1) Highlight the layers you want. The selected layers must all belong to the same parent layer.

2) Right click > Plugins > Reverse Layers

3) Voila!


You can hit CMD+Option+P to run the most recently ran plugin.


If you use this a lot please consider donating via PayPal to hoyoul@gmail.com or Venmo @hoyoul. Thanks!

plugins.name: Utopia / Fluid type + space calculator
plugins.description:
Utopia is a systematic approach to fluid type and space design. This plugin generates named type styles and space components from a handful of editable values. This kickstarts your design project with a palette of related building blocks for use at your minimum and maximum viewport widths.


The purpose of the plugin is to automate the laborious process of creating and organising an initial set of components and styles.


If you prefer, you can configure your type and space scales at utopia.fyi and paste the resulting URL into this plugin.


Values can be edited by running the plugin again. Changes made to the generated type styles will persist as long as the styles are not renamed. For instance you can change the font in Figma and re-run the plugin without the text reverting back to the default font. To reset everything, delete the artboards, the generated styles, and the generated variable collections.
plugins.tagline: Generate fluid type styles, space components and responsive grids to kickstart your design projects

The purpose of the plugin is to automate the laborious process of creating and organising an initial set of components and styles.


If you prefer, you can configure your type and space scales at utopia.fyi and paste the resulting URL into this plugin.


Values can be edited by running the plugin again. Changes made to the generated type styles will persist as long as the styles are not renamed. For instance you can change the font in Figma and re-run the plugin without the text reverting back to the default font. To reset everything, delete the artboards, the generated styles, and the generated variable collections.
92721.release_notes:
Major release - this is a breaking change. Utopia type & space scale calculator has been entirely rewritten to use typographic variables, and support modes:

- Type & space variables
- Fluid variable collection
- Modes used (where supported)
- Space pairs (one up & custom)
- Compatibility with the new Utopia Kickstarter
- Dark mode

plugins.name: Flock Figma to React Component
plugins.description:
Transform Figma Designs into React Code

Generate React code from your Figma designs with an opinionated format built around material UI and the Flock component library.


Usage

Switch to Dev mode and change the language under the Code section to Flock Figma to React Component to generate code. This tool will generate the code following the convention of div's being replaced with MUI boxes and components being replaced with components from '@flock/shared-ui'.


To use your own library, simply replace imports from '@flock/shared-ui' with your own component library.


If you want the plugin to replace instances of your component or your style definitions with their tokens, go to the Plugins panel in Dev Mode and run this plugin to set your Figma API token and the file that contains your style library.
plugins.tagline: Use Figma to generate React components in Flock style.

plugins.name: Stacks
plugins.description:
Stacks provide extensive, semi-automated control over the spacing, direction and alignment of layers. 

How-to:
Stacks are applied to a parent Frame or Component, and affect their child layers. To create a Stack, select either a single Frame or Component, or two or more layers, and choose ‚ÄòCreate/Edit Stack‚Äô. When you make a change within a Stack, choose ‚ÄôUpdate Selected Stacks‚Äô or ‚ÄòUpdate All Stacks‚Äô to update the layout. Pro tip: bind these to a keyboard shortcut to speed up your workflow.

Stack parameters:
* Spacing: The amount of space separating layers.
* Direction: Whether layers should be stacked horizontally or vertically.
* Alignment: Whether layers should be aligned to the top, middle or bottom of their parent Frame or Component. This is optional, so layers can maintain their original alignment.
* Anchoring: The corner to which the parent container resizes relative to.

Other notes:
* Stacks can be nested inside of other Stacks.
* Stacks applied to Components also affect their instances. Instances cannot currently be overridden since Figma doesn't support overriding instance child layer positions.
* Stacks carry over to different pages/documents if the element is copied and pasted to a different 
* Feature requests welcome :)

Roadmap:
[ ] If Figma adds support for triggering code on events, I‚Äôll add functionality to update Stacks automatically when their contents are changed.

plugins.name: Mirror Actual Size
plugins.description:
Mirror the actual size of your current design on Figma Mirror. Very useful when you don't have all devices with different sizes, or you are designing for IoT or print materials. E.g. a Raspberry Pi screen, a business card.


How to

  • Run plugin, or select a frame and run plugin
  • Enter the screen specs
  • Hit enter. This plugin will frame your artboard so what you see on Figma Mirror is the actual size.
  • (use a ruler to check if you doubt üåû )
  • Enjoy the actual sizing on your Figma Mirror app.

plugins.name: Variable Visualizer
plugins.description:
Variable Visualizer (VV)


Transform how you work with Figma variables. VV turns complex variable relationships into an intuitive visual map, letting you see and manage all your variables in one infinite canvas.


Key Features


  1. View all variable collections at once on an infinite canvas
  2. Visualize and create variable connections through simple drag-and-drop
  3. Simulate different modes to preview how variables behave without building components
  4. Quick-search variables and jump directly to them
  5. See all variables used in any selected layer or component


VV makes designing Figma variables feel less like navigating a dark forest and more like having a clear map at hand.


Quick Start


  1. Open the plugin to see all your variable collections laid out visually
  2. Drag between ports to create variable connections
  3. Use mode simulation to test different variable states
  4. Search or select layers to find specific variables


Whether you're new to Figma variables or managing complex design systems, VV helps you understand and control your variables with confidence.
plugins.tagline: Visualize and manage Figma variables with ease
